definitions.definition: an alphabetical list, such as one printed at the back of a book showing which page a subject, name, etc. is on:
examples: Try looking up "heart disease" in the index.

definitions.definition: a collection of information stored on a computer or on a set of cards, in alphabetical order:
examples: He still has all his friends' names and addresses on a card index.

definitions.definition: to prepare an index for a book or collection, or arrange it in an index:
examples: Our computer indexes several thousand new records every second.
